snippet: Democrats and Republicans agreed last summer to automatic reductions in military spending if they could not agree later on shrinking the deficit, and so far they have not.
abstract: Several Republican lawmakers are seeking a way to avert or offset $600 billion in military budget cuts that are scheduled to take effect Jan 2, 2013; Democrats and Republicans had agreed to cuts if they could not shrink the deficit by at least $1.2 trillion.
lead_paragraph: Democrats and Republicans agreed last summer to automatic reductions in military spending if they could not agree later on shrinking the deficit, and so far they have not.

headline.seo: Budget Control Act Military Cuts Raise Concerns
headline.main: Some Lawmakers Look for Way Out as Defense Cuts Near
headline.print_headline: As Automatic Military Cuts Draw Nearer, Some Lawmakers Look for Way Out
